properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 10 at 6:14PM CST by NWS Little Rock AR
properties.description:
At 613 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over
White Oak Lake State Park, or 17 miles northwest of Camden, moving
northeast at 50 mph.

Pea size hail and winds in excess of 40 mph will be possible with
this storm.

Locations impacted include...
Bearden...                        Sparkman...
Chidester...                      Poison Springs State Park...
White Oak Lake State Park...      Amy...
Ouachita...                       Holly Springs...
Reader...                         Vaden...
Tates Bluff...                    Pine Grove...
Bragg City...                     Millville...
properties.instruction:
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm, and may lead
to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded
roadways.

Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm.
Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe
shelter inside a building or vehicle.

This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio
stations and available television stations for additional information
and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

NWSheadline: SIGNIFICANT WEATHER ADVISORY FOR SOUTHEASTERN CLARK...SOUTHWESTERN DALLAS AND NORTHERN OUACHITA COUNTIES UNTIL 645 PM CST
